title.rendered: Doo Financial Expands Hong Kong Footprint with Type 1 License

content.rendered:
Doo Group has announced that its subsidiary, Doo Financial HK Limited, has been granted the Type 1 (Dealing in Securities) License by the Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission (HK SFC).

The Type 1 license is a critical authorization for companies offering securities trading services in Hong Kong. The HK SFC awards this license after a thorough review of an applicant’s business operations, financial standing, corporate governance, and staff qualifications.

By obtaining this license, Doo Financial HK gains the ability to execute securities transactions, distribute specific securities like unit trusts and mutual funds, and participate in joint book-running, placing, and underwriting activities.

The Hong Kong market plays a vital role in Doo Group’s strategic expansion plans. Acquiring the Type 1 license allows Doo Financial HK to expand its service portfolio and offer a wider range of financial products and services to investors, opening up new investment opportunities.

Doo Financial HK already holds the HK SFC’s Type 4 (Advising on Securities) and Type 9 (Asset Management) licenses. The Type 1 license further strengthens Doo Group’s position as a comprehensive financial solutions provider in Hong Kong, adhering to rigorous regulatory standards across its services: securities trading, investment advice, and asset management.

This expanded service portfolio positions Doo Group to cater to a wider range of client needs, whether clients seek to trade in global capital markets or invest in over-the-counter (OTC) assets. Hong Kong serves not only as a key growth market for Doo Group but also as a gateway to mainland China.

Doo Group has a well-established global presence, with over 10 offices worldwide and a team of more than 550 industry professionals serving clients across 40 countries and regions. The company’s recent sponsorship deal with Manchester United further highlights its commitment to brand building and reaching a broader audience.
